definition: to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize

sentences.english: Within three years he accumulated great wealth by speculations in stocks.
sentences.chinese: 三年內他靠炒買股票積聚了大量財富。

sentences.english: But there’s another, darker kind of nontraditional power China is currently amassing.
sentences.chinese: 但中國目前在積聚另一種較爲黑暗的非傳統力量。

sentences.english: Accumulations, rous 'd love and joy and thought.
sentences.chinese: 那些積聚，被勾起的愛和歡樂，以及思索。

sentences.english: Foam is the other common type of air in oil. Foam typically refers to the stable layer of relatively large bubbles that accumulate at the surface of a reservoir.
sentences.chinese: 泡沫是指相對較大的泡泡穩定積聚在油液表面。

sentences.english: Note the dark red congested regions that represent accumulation of RBC's in centrilobular regions.
sentences.chinese: 暗紅色淤血區表示肝小葉中心區的紅細胞積聚。

sentences.english: I must have accumulated some merit during my past lives.
sentences.chinese: 過去生裏，我定曾積聚功德。

sentences.english: An electic current is applied to the cell, converting the aluminium surface into a coating of aluminium oxide.
sentences.chinese: 電解池通過電流，鋁片的表面就逐漸積聚起氧化鋁層。

sentences.english: The accumulation of unswallowed saliva in the pharynx causes the sensation of choking .
sentences.chinese: 不能嚥下的唾液積聚在咽部引起窒息感。

sentences.english: NB: If glucose can't get into the cells, it builds up in the blood.
sentences.chinese: 如果葡萄糖不能進入細胞，就會積聚在血液中。

sentences.english: Lymphedema is characterized by a regional accumulation of excessive amounts of interstitial protein-rich fluid.
sentences.chinese: 淋巴水腫的特點是過量間質性富蛋白液的局部積聚。

sentences.english: Substrates may accumulate intracellularly against a concentration gradient.
sentences.chinese: 底物可以逆濃度梯度而積聚於細胞內。

sentences.english: Rain water collected in the drainpipe.
That is because the heavy snows that have been accumulating in central China were falling on places far out of the spotlight.
sentences.chinese: 那是因爲華中積聚的大雪降落在遠離聚光燈的地方。

sentences.english: Additional antistatic action will considerably retard new soiling and attraction of dust.
sentences.chinese: 添加的防靜電劑能有效防止產生新的污垢和灰塵積聚。

sentences.english: Wealth accumulated through various controversial websites.
sentences.chinese: 積聚的財富通過各種爭議性網站。

sentences.english: Occasionally people get an uncomfortable ear wax build up.
sentences.chinese: 有時耳屎積聚太多，讓人感到不舒服。

definition: to stock up/to lay in supplies/to hoard (for speculation)/to corner the market in sth
within the body/in vivo (vs in vitro)/internal to
to arise/to come into being/to come about/to give rise to/to bring into being/to bring about/to produce/to engender/to generate/to appear/appearance/emergence/generation/production/yield
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
